answers.answer: Newcomers in Constanța can find support for immigration, accommodation, meals, integration, transportation, medical needs, psychological well-being, education, legal and social advice, and language courses. Additionally, there is support for employment access, cultural integration, women's health and safety, and HIV services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: To travel within the city of Constanța, individuals can use the bus. Further information on bus lines is available through a provided link.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Transportation'.

answers.answer: Individuals can seek medical assistance at the Constanța Emergency County Clinical Hospital Sf Apostol Andrei, including its Pediatric Clinical Department for children. A list of family doctors for Constanța county is also available.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Psychological support in Constanța is offered by World Vision Romania, Terre des hommes Foundation, and The International Organization for Migration (IOM). The Sensiblu Foundation also provides face-to-face or online psychotherapy.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The Constanța County School Inspectorate provides information on the enrollment of Ukrainian students in Romanian pre-university education units and on studying the Romanian language and civilization. Specific documents and more details can be found via their provided link.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Legal assistance for new residents in Constanța is provided by AIDRom and the ROUA Center. The Sensiblu Foundation also offers legal advice and representation in court.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: AIDRom offers support in accessing the labor market for individuals seeking employment in Constanța. Further information may be available under the 'Jobs' section.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Help for accommodation, board, and integration in Constanța is available through a specific support program, for which more information is provided. Additionally, Novapolis Association offers services including transport and accommodation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Constanța' and 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Organizations offering general assistance in Constanța include CNRR, AIDRom, ROUA Center, Constanta Regional Integration Center (JRS Romania Association), Sensiblu Foundation, and Novapolis Association. These organizations provide a range of support services from advice to integration.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The key emergency call number for Constanța is 112. The National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania can also be reached at 0800 800 678 or 021 313 3100.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: Specialized support for women's health and safety in Constanța is provided by a Women's Center, which assists with reproductive health services and domestic violence. The Sensiblu Foundation also offers a support network for women and girls.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Women's Center' and 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Individuals can find a family doctor in Constanța county by accessing the provided list of family doctors.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Psychological counseling services in Constanța are offered in Russian, Ukrainian, Romanian, and English. World Vision Romania provides support in Russian and Ukrainian, while IOM offers advice in all four languages.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The Immigration Service of Constanța county helps with immigration services. Their contact numbers are provided.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-constanta and read the section under 'Important contacts'.
